title: Buddhist Dharma - Ven Gareth Sparham - Tantric Buddhist Morality
description:
** Venerable Gareth Sparham **
** Tibetan Tantric Teachings **
** Buddhist Morality **
 <a href="
http://www.lsa.umich.edu/asian/asian_detail/0,2929,25247%255Fpeople%255F21443229,00.html" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.lsa.umich.edu/asian/asian_detail/0,2929,25247%255Fpeople%255F21443229,00.html</a>

Gareth Sparham was born in England and grew up in Canada. He received a 
BA from McGill University and a PhD in Asian Studies from the University 
of British Columbia. He was a Buddhist monk from 1973 - 2001, studying 
at the Institute of Buddhist Dialectics at Dharamsala and making retreat 
in India for most of that time. He has written and translated a number 
of books (some listed below). At present he teaches Sanskrit and Tibetan 
language at the University of Michigan and gives courses on Buddhism and 
meditation worldwide.


Books by Gareth Sparham (not included in this torrent):

Tantric Ethics: An Explanation of the Precepts for Buddhist Vajrayana    
      Practice; 
      by Tsongkhapa, 
      and Gareth Sparham

Ocean of Eloquence: Commentary on the Yogacara Doctrine of Mind: 
      (SUNY Series in Buddhist Studies); 
      by Tson-kha-pa Blo-bzan-grags-pa, 
      and Gareth Sparham

Fulfillment of All Hopes: Guru Devotion in Tibetan Buddhism; 
      by Je Tsongkhapa, 
      and Gareth Sparham

Memoirs of a Tibetan Lama; 
      by Lobsang Gyatso,
      and Gareth Sparham

Ocean of Eloquence: Commentary on the Yogacara Doctrine of Mind: 
      (SUNY Series in Buddhist Studies); 
      by Tson-kha-pa Blo-bzan-grags-pa, 
      and Gareth Sparham

Dhammapada: Tibetan Dhammapada: Sayings of the Buddha 
      (A Wisdom basic book. Orange series);
      by Dharmatrata, 
      Blo-Bzan-Rgya-Mtsho, 
      Ngawang Thekchok, 
      Beth Lee Simon,
      and Gareth Sparham

Golden Garland of Eloquence; 
      by Tsong Kha Pa, 
      and Gareth Sparham

Abhisamayalamkara with Vrtti and Aloka;
      by Arya Vimuktisena, 
      Haribhadara, 
      and Gareth Sparham
